p:
A model simulation of the period 1950–2003 using the Whole Atmosphere Community Climate Model (WACCM) showed no significant long-term temperature trend near the mesopause (~80–90 km), although cooling trends were determined in the stratosphere below, and in the thermosphere above
15 . A similar result was found using the Hamburg Model of the Neutral and Ionized Atmosphere (HAMMONIA) in a CO 2 doubling experiment
16 . Using 20-year simulations with a doubling of CO 2 above the then current concentrations, cooling was found everywhere above the tropopause, but with the smallest effect occurring at the mesopause.
